modules.description: This module provides low-level functions for building and pushing Docker images using OCluster, including direct control over build specifications and cache hints. It operates on Git commit identifiers, Docker image targets, and obuilder job specifications. Concrete use cases include defining custom Docker build pipelines with specific build options and managing image deployment to remote registries.

This module manages connections to an OCluster scheduler, handling job submission, automatic reconnection, rate-limited queuing, and metrics reporting. It works with OCluster submission services and job capabilities, allowing custom pipeline steps through direct interaction with resource pools and job execution. Use it to integrate OCluster-based build pipelines with OCurrent, enabling fault-tolerant job scheduling and log tracking.

This module configures and executes builds on an OCluster, integrating Docker image construction, obuilder job execution, and Git source handling with support for timeouts, authentication, and urgency policies. It provides direct APIs for defining build pipelines, pushing Docker images, and submitting jobs to cluster schedulers, working with types like Git commits, Docker targets, and job specifications. Submodules enable low-level control over image builds and cache hints, as well as connection management for job submission, reconnection, and metrics. Use it to automate Docker image deployment, run custom obuilder jobs, and integrate fault-tolerant, rate-limited build pipelines with OCurrent.
